<cs> my lords it is a pleasure to follow the two immensely distinguished medical peers who have spoken this evening <e> <s> i should like to commence by offering my thanks to the noble lord lord prys-davies for bring this matter forward <e> <s> if i may without seeming patronising or indeed impertinent i congratulate him on the way he presented this debate <e>

<cs> my lords i cannot answer the noble lords question <e> <s> i know only what goes on in southampton and it would be quite wrong and indeed stupid for me to comment on what goes on elsewhere <e> <s> i am sorry but i cannot help him <e>

<cs> my lords we stand at the threshold of the season we call spring <e> <s> it is a time of excitement and promise <e> <s> the excitement seldom fails but alas <e> <s> the promise is sometimes unfulfilled <e> <s> a poet forebear of mine began one of his pieces like this <e>
<cs> my lords i beg to move that the bill be now read a third time <e>

<cs> my lords with the leave of the house i should like to conclude the debate on this third reading <e> <s> we have heard a number of extremely interesting views from distinguished minds <e> <s> let me say at once that i am not a legal person and i am not qualified to enter into complex arguments or to give a view about what seem to me to be complex legal and constitutional points <e>
